text: This is a survey of the postage stamps and postal history of Macau. == Colonial history == The first stamps issued for Macau by the Portuguese was in 1884. The common "Portuguese crown" design was used and nine values ranging from 5 to 300 reis were made. == Transfer of sovereignty over Macau == When Macau became a special administrative region of the People's Republic of China, all stamps with "Macau, Portuguese Republic" () were no longer used. Instead, "Macau, China" was printed on the stamp. == Further reading == * Yang's Catalog of the Postage Stamps and Postal Stationery of Macau (1998). == Other websites == * Encyclopaedia of Postal Authorities, Macao (Macau). Macau Macau Category:Macau
title: Postage stamps and postal history of Macau
